Tear of the Dragon: Bard 16 / Rogue 14 / Red Dragon Disciple 10
by Kail Pendragon & Conlaoch

Devastating Critical (lvl 27) and Epic Dodge (lvl 33) together with 16th level Bard/Curse Song coupled in one build and a playable one on top, with buffing/debuffing capabilities, +7d6 sneak attack, an acceptable AB figure especially considering curse song and taunt, a more than promising AC one, craft wand, epic trap skills. Bard maturity is reached late, but that's in order to get ED asap. I still wanted to get as many bard levels as soon as possible to take advantage of bard song and spells (and craft wand). Rogue levels are spaced in order to grant increasing trap skills and epic traps are handled (without gear) by level 33.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
This is the one! I take my hat off to you guys for this one! It's AMAZING not only because it gets the best of two worlds, but also because it does so while remaining exquisitely playable throughout. There is just one thing I don't understand, though: Why Rogue 14? Just for 43 Disable Traps? For all the other totals, you can go Bard 17 Rogue 13 RDD 10 and still max out Tumble, UMD and get the same skill totals you have while gaining a little bit of durations and a few spells per day (1 lvl 3, 1 lvl 5 and 1 lvl 6, plus 1 more known level 6 spell). Is there a particular reason for this?

Also, I'd trade some of the Disable Traps for Open Locks. If you leave DT at 36 (taking the last Rogue at 33), you get 10 points to spend in Open Lock, with the bonuses from Bard Song and Thieves Tools, there will be very few locks that you won't be able to open.

Still, FANTASTIC BUILD! If we do that "Hall of Fame" thing I suggested to you, Kail, this one would definitely have my vote!

Take it EZ!

EDIT: One more thing: I'd take that second Rogue level right away at lvl 2 for Evasion right off the bat.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Often times I don't worry too much about skill progression. I tend to let the environment I play in dictate how I fill in the skills.

For instance, if I was playing this build on a world where there were lot's of traps, I'd be capping trap skills and search at every chance. If traps are rare but casters are abundant, I'd cap spellcraft and taunt as the 30% chance of spell failure can be a life saver.

I usually hold off on tumble until I can dump at least 5 points in as I want the AC boost.

You're skill progression looks fine, just be aware that if you happen to miss skill dumping for a few levels, it's no big deal.


Conlaoch

Hey Theo, you forgot EVASION, which is one of the best feats in NWN. It may not seem like much, but the usefulness is amazing because there are LOADS of low-DC reflex saves that you need to make when faced with the appropriate situations, and that just having Evasion will avoid them almost entirely, except for Autofail. The main one is rock-hurling from giants and other monster types. The DC is generally low, so you will make the save for half damage, but that will still eat through your Stoneskin and other limited DR properties without Evasion. With it, you're practically immune to them. Also, Breath Weapons from Dragons and affiliates, some types of traps and a few other monster special abilities, such as the Shield Guardian's Fireball spell. Not to mention spells. I would go as far as to say that Evasion is WAY better than Improved Evasion.

Also, CT, there are traps with certain DCs that only Rogues can disable, I don't remember the exact number, maybe one of my wingmen can help me out here. 

You'll be pleased to know that this build is saved in my all-time favorites folder, although my version is slightly different (I went Bard 17 / Rogue 13).

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
This build does not have Heavy Armor prof, so it will not have access to Full Plate.

Also, level 33 needs to be the opposite - Defensive Roll then Epic Dodge (one needs Defensive Roll to get Epic Dodge).

In my experience on WoG, there are enough traps to recover that one does not necessarily need to craft them.  Also, there are plenty of merchants who sell traps as well. YMMV.

As one cannot craft Epic Traps at this time, they can only be recovered (I think there was a discussion about this).

As for Listen and Spot - this really depends on how one wants to go about it.  One can go the Equipment route (in which one doesn't need much Listen and Spot for detecting creatures) or one can get some decent Listen and Spot and buff with spells.  Either way, one doesn't need all that much.  I personally would recommend going with one or the other, and not both.  Apparently, with Blindfight, Spot is better than with Listen.

My question is, why do you want DP so badly?

Tensor's Transformation is much better on WoG (it's the PnP version), and is easier to come by (one can get potions of it if one wants).  It also lasts longer than DP from a scroll or item.  DP is level 7, TT is level 11 iirc.

The only drawback to TT is that you cannot cast while it is active.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
eburro6416 wrote:So to maximize my AC with armor should I go for as much Dex bonus as I can?
Being that this build will have 26 DEX (+8 modifier), provided you can max out multiple stats, you can walk around in robes and get a total of +14 DEX AC.

Alternatively, if you feel that the magic level is low and prefer to focus only on one stat, then you could wear a padded armor and completely ignore DEX items. Technically, that's the same AC bonus as a full plate (8 armor 1 dex for the FP, 1 armor 8 dex for the padded armor).

However, It's worth noting that this build will change armor a lot as it flourishes on stats, so you could start off with a chain shirt and kind of work your way up from there as your DEX gets higher.

And just as a final note, this build doesn't necessarily have a monster AC per se. It's more of a well-rounded type.

posts.content:
I really like this build. 

Dev Crit, Epic Dodge, Bard/Curse level 16 song, Level 1-6 bard spell casting (Silence, Darkness/Ultravision, Haste/GMW, Improved Invisibility, War Cry/Dirge/Energy Buffer), Taunt, UMD, Evasion, able to retrieve and set epic traps, quite good melee and ranged AB for a bard build, +4 AC from RDD 10 and +8 AC from Tumble 40. No need for auto-still III if one is wearing robes.
Wow! Thanks for working on this Conlaoch and Kail! 

I wish it had blind fight and knockdown but that would cost toughness (for much needed HP) and craft wand (for much needed spells/day). 
If someone has a friend to make wands for you in a PW, craft wand could be dropped for one of the two (I would choose knockdown to help deal with casters). 
A detection skill would be nice but I think amplify and true seeing with UMD can cover this.

One small suggestion. 
I think a value skill point or two can be put into Open Lock. With two ranks in open lock, with capped Dex (+14), Bard 16 song (+4) and a +10 thieves tool (+10), this would allow the build to unlock DC 50 locks with Take 20. Even more if there are items that add to open lock. That skill point or two can be taken from search putting it to 20(21), I don't think that is too different from search 22(23).

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Orion wrote:
Aug 02, 2020
That skill point or two can be taken from search putting it to 20(21), I don't think that is too different from search 22(23). 
The detect DC for vanilla epic traps in a module is 43. With a search of 23 you can detect them - eventually - on a 20 roll.
I guess that is the reason for 23 ranks here.
Boosting intelligence, singing a song or equipping an item with a skill bonus will all help and make it possible to detect epic traps even with less than 23 ranks, but the margin is small.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
That's a good point Mick and very well considered.
The vanilla find traps spell will mean one loses the opportunity to retrieve such epic traps which cannot be crafted so the search is valuable, 
Boosting it from 23 with +4 from song and +1-2 from fox's increases the chances of detecting them significantly, compared with search 21.
Increasing the chance to detect the trap from 5% (a 20 roll) to 25% (a 16-20 roll) is a big deal, its a 500% increase in effectiveness.

Perhaps then, instead of taking that skill point or two from search, I would take it from Taunt 41(44), making it Taunt 39(42). 
With curse (-4 to enemy concentration) and bard song (+4 to taunt skill) it might be more forgiving than taking it out of search, or spellcraft, or UMD (or others).
